info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 7:59PM EDT until May 16 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR EASTERN MITCHELL...AVERY AND NORTHEASTERN YANCEY COUNTIES... At 759 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Newland, or near Crossnore, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Newland, Banner Elk, Elk Park, Bakersville, Crossnore, Sugar Mountain, Seven Devils, Grandfather Mountain State Park and B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
